title: Create template/ directory with 17-language scaffold
description:
## Overview
Create a template directory that can be used to scaffold new .do domain repositories (mongo.do, database.do, agents.do, etc.)

## Structure
```
template/
├── packages/
│   ├── typescript/     # {name}.do npm package stub
│   ├── python/         # {name}-do PyPI package stub
│   ├── rust/           # {name}-do crates.io stub
│   ├── go/             # go.{name}.do stub
│   └── ... (all 17 languages)
├── scripts/
│   ├── build.ts        # Cross-language build
│   ├── test.ts         # Cross-language test runner
│   └── publish.ts      # Multi-registry publish
├── .github/
│   └── workflows/
│       ├── test.yml    # CI test workflow
│       └── publish.yml # Release publish workflow
├── test/
│   └── conformance/    # YAML test specs (copied/customized)
└── template.json       # Template metadata and placeholders
```

## Placeholders
- `{{name}}` - Domain name (e.g., "mongo", "database")
- `{{Name}}` - PascalCase (e.g., "Mongo", "Database")  
- `{{NAME}}` - UPPERCASE (e.g., "MONGO", "DATABASE")

## TDD Approach
1. RED: Write tests for template variable substitution
2. GREEN: Implement substitution logic
3. REFACTOR: Extract reusable scaffolding utilities

title: TDD: Implement Rust rpc-do SDK with conformance tests
description:
## Overview
Implement the Rust rpc-do SDK using TDD against the conformance test suite.

## TDD Cycle

### RED - Failing conformance tests
```bash
cd packages/rust
cargo test conformance -- --nocapture
```

### GREEN - Implement to pass
1. WebSocket transport using tokio-tungstenite
2. RpcPromise as Future implementation
3. Macro-based or trait-based stub generation
4. .map() with closure capture

### REFACTOR
- Zero-copy where possible
- Proper error types (thiserror)
- Feature flags for async runtimes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All conformance tests pass
- [ ] No unsafe code (or well-documented)
- [ ] Works with tokio and async-std
- [ ] Package publishable as `rpc-do` on crates.io

title: Update package names to {name}.do format
description:
## Overview
Update all package manifests to use the new {name}.do naming convention.

## Changes per Language

### TypeScript (npm)
- packages/typescript/rpc/package.json: name → "rpc.do"

### Python (PyPI)  
- packages/python/rpc/pyproject.toml: name → "rpc-do"

### Rust (crates.io)
- packages/rust/rpc/Cargo.toml: name → "rpc-do"

### Go
- packages/go/rpc/go.mod: module → "go.rpc.do"

### Ruby (RubyGems)
- packages/ruby/rpc/*.gemspec: name → "rpc.do"

### Java/Kotlin (Maven)
- packages/java/rpc/build.gradle.kts: group → "do.rpc"
- packages/kotlin/rpc/build.gradle.kts: group → "do.rpc"

### C#/F# (NuGet)
- packages/dotnet/rpc/*.csproj: PackageId → "Rpc.Do"
- packages/fsharp/rpc/*.fsproj: PackageId → "Rpc.Do"

### Others
- Dart: rpc_do
- Elixir: :rpc_do
- PHP: rpc.do/sdk
- And remaining languages...

## Validation
- Run `npm run validate:packages` to verify all names follow convention

title: TDD: Implement TypeScript rpc.do SDK with conformance tests
description:
## Overview
Implement the TypeScript rpc.do SDK using TDD (red-green-refactor) against the conformance test suite.

## TDD Cycle

### RED - Failing conformance tests
The conformance tests in test/conformance/*.yaml define expected behavior:
- basic.yaml: square(), returnNumber(), makeCounter()
- pipelining.yaml: Promise pipelining, single round-trip chains
- map.yaml: Server-side .map() operations

Run tests expecting failures:
```bash
npm test -- --grep "conformance"
```

### GREEN - Implement to pass
1. WebSocket transport connecting to test server
2. RpcPromise with .then(), .catch(), property access
3. Proxy-based stub for zero-schema method calls
4. .map() with record/replay

### REFACTOR - Clean up implementation
- Extract transport layer
- Separate protocol encoding from client API
- Add TypeScript generics for type safety

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All basic.yaml tests pass
- [ ] All pipelining.yaml tests pass  
- [ ] All map.yaml tests pass
- [ ] TypeScript types properly inferred
- [ ] Package publishable as `rpc.do` on npm

title: Set up test server for conformance testing
description:
## Overview
Set up the capnweb test server to run conformance tests against all SDK implementations.

## Tasks
1. Copy/adapt test server from official capnweb repo
2. Ensure it exposes TestTarget interface:
   - square(n) -> n*n
   - returnNumber(n) -> n
   - makeCounter(initial) -> Counter capability
   - generateFibonacci(n) -> array
   - callFunction(stub, method, args) -> result
3. Add remap/map operation support
4. Create npm script to start test server

## Test Server Interface
```typescript
interface TestTarget {
  square(n: number): number
  returnNumber(n: number): number
  returnNull(): null
  returnUndefined(): undefined
  makeCounter(initial: number): Counter
  generateFibonacci(n: number): number[]
  callFunction(stub: any, method: string, args: any[]): any
}

interface Counter {
  value: number
  increment(by: number): number
  decrement(by: number): number
}
```

## Scripts
```bash
npm run test:server     # Start test server
npm run test:all        # Start server + run all language tests
```

title: Build CLI for scaffolding new .do repos
description:
## Overview
Create a CLI tool to scaffold new .do domain repositories from the template.

## Usage
```bash
# Via npx
npx dotdo init mongo

# Or installed globally
dotdo init database --output ../database

# Interactive mode
dotdo init
? Domain name: agents
? Description: AI agent orchestration
? Include all 17 languages? Yes
```

## Features
- Template variable substitution
- Language selection (all or subset)
- Git init + initial commit
- Optional: Create GitHub repo via gh CLI

## TDD Approach (Red-Green-Refactor)

### RED Phase - Write failing tests first:
```typescript
describe('dotdo init', () => {
  it('should substitute {{name}} placeholders', async () => {
    const result = await scaffold('mongo', template)
    expect(result.files['package.json']).toContain('"name": "mongo.do"')
  })
  
  it('should generate correct package names per registry', async () => {
    const result = await scaffold('database', template)
    expect(result.packages.npm).toBe('database.do')
    expect(result.packages.pypi).toBe('database-do')
    expect(result.packages.crates).toBe('database-do')
  })
  
  it('should create all 17 language directories', async () => {
    const result = await scaffold('agents', template)
    expect(result.languages).toHaveLength(17)
  })
})
```

### GREEN Phase - Implement to pass tests
### REFACTOR Phase - Extract PackageNamer, TemplateEngine utilities

## Implementation
- TypeScript CLI using Commander.js
- Published as `dotdo` npm package (the CLI, not the SDK)
- Uses degit or simple file copy for scaffolding
